Title: DPFunc: accurately predicting protein function via deep learning with domain-guided structure information
Key Insights: Introduces domain-guided structure information with GNNs and attention mechanisms. Achieves 8-16% improvement in Fmax over GAT-GO across molecular function, cellular component, and biological process prediction.

Title: Deep learning methods for protein function prediction
Key Insights: Comprehensive review of deep learning methods including CNNs, RNNs, transformers, and protein language models. Identifies key challenges in rare function prediction and structure integration.

Title: Evaluating the advancements in protein language models for protein function prediction
Key Insights: Systematic review of protein language models evolution from LSTM-based to transformer architectures. Demonstrates superior performance of PLMs in capturing sequence-function relationships.

Title: TAWFN: a deep learning framework for protein function prediction
Key Insights: Two-model adaptive weight fusion network (TAWFN) combining CNN and GCN for structure-based prediction. Achieved AUPR of 0.718, 0.385, 0.488 for MF, BP, CC tasks respectively.

Title: Enhanced prediction of protein functional identity through the integration of sequence and structural similarities
Key Insights: Machine learning approach analyzing sequence and structural similarities for enzymatic function prediction. Demonstrates improved accuracy through multi-modal feature integration.

Title: Functional Annotation of Proteomes Using Protein Language Models
Key Insights: FANTASIA tool utilizing ProtTrans embeddings for large-scale proteome annotation. Shows superior per-protein annotation precision for functional genomics applications.

Title: Evaluating large language models for annotating proteins
Key Insights: Evaluation of protein language models (ESM, ProtTrans) with transfer learning for Pfam annotation. Achieved impressive 60% error reduction compared to standard methods.

Title: FAPM: functional annotation of proteins using multimodal models beyond structural modeling
Key Insights: Novel multimodal contrastive learning framework combining protein language models with natural language models. Generates functional annotations in natural language, achieving state-of-the-art on public benchmarks and phage proteins.

Title: Using deep learning and large protein language models to predict membrane-interacting amino acids
Key Insights: Application of ESM and ProtTrans models for protein-membrane interface prediction. Achieved F1 scores of 0.8 and 0.77 respectively, with significant speed improvements.

Title: Current successes and remaining challenges in protein function prediction
Key Insights: Analysis of CAFA challenges and current limitations. Highlights need for structure integration, rare function prediction, and better evaluation metrics in computational approaches.

Title: ProteInfer, deep neural networks for protein functional inference
Key Insights: Deep convolutional neural networks for direct EC number and GO term prediction from sequences. Achieves competitive performance with lightweight, browser-based interface for real-time prediction.

Title: In silico protein function prediction: the rise of machine learning-powered approaches
Key Insights: Review highlighting protein language models (ProtTrans, ESM) as breakthrough methods. Shows 60% error reduction compared to traditional methods in protein family classification.

Title: Transformer-based deep learning for predicting protein properties in the life sciences
Key Insights: Comprehensive review of transformer applications in protein property prediction. Analyzes attention mechanisms, pre-training strategies, and interpretability in protein sequence analysis.

Title: A Review of Deep Learning Techniques for Protein Function Prediction
Key Insights: Comprehensive analysis of CNN, RNN, and transformer architectures for protein function prediction. Emphasizes emergence of attention-based models and multi-modal learning approaches.

Title: Structure-based protein function prediction using graph convolutional networks
Key Insights: DeepFRI uses graph convolutional networks with protein language model features. Demonstrated robustness to structure prediction errors and achieved residue-level functional site identification.

Title: Accurate protein function prediction via graph attention networks with predicted structure information
Key Insights: Graph attention networks with predicted protein structures and ESM-1b embeddings. Outperformed DeepFRI significantly with Fmax 0.637, 0.510, 0.542 for MF, BPO, CCO domains.
